article.headline: Alabama 63, SE Louisiana 61
article.story: TUSCALOOSA, Ala. (AP) -- Mykal Riley scored a game-high 23 points -- including all nine of Alabama's points in overtime -- to clinch the Tide's 63-61 win over Southeastern Louisiana on Saturday. Alabama (4-2) was trailing 54-48 when Riley hit a 3-pointer with 18 seconds left just as the officials blew the whistle for an off-the-ball foul against USL (5-2). The basket counted and the Tide got the ball back. Seven seconds later, Justin Tubbs nailed his second 3-pointer of the game to tie the score at 54-54. "I've been waiting a long time for this, since the beginning of the season," Riley said. "It seemed like I could never catch fire. I've been shooting badly lately, but I'm glad I was able to pull it off in overtime. It helps my confidence a lot to know that I can shoot the ball still." Richard Hendrix contributed 17 points, seven rebounds and a season-high four blocks for the Tide. USL took a 25-23 lead into the half and led for almost the entire second half before Bama's two clutch 3-pointers in the waning seconds tied the ballgame. Kevyn Green led the way for the Lions, scoring 22 points and grabbing six rebounds. Dekyron Nicks and Warrell Span also finished in double-figures, scoring 14 and 10 points respectively. Alabama shot 27 percent from the floor in the first half but improved to 33 percent after the break while Southeastern Louisiana shot 45 percent in the first and 42 percent in the second half. Tide coach Mark Gottfried said his team was very fortunate to win after a night of offensive shooting that he's "never been around." "We couldn't throw the ball in the ocean tonight," he said. "It was not a lot of bad shots, we just couldn't make them. It was just one of those nights."

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
